info.title: API Reference
info.description: API for Cyberdesk, to create, control, and manage virtual desktop instances.

get.summary: Get details of a specific desktop instance
get.description: Returns the ID, status, creation timestamp, and timeout timestamp for a given desktop instance.

schema.description: The UUID of the desktop instance to retrieve

id.description: Unique identifier for the desktop instance

status.description: Current status of the desktop instance

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the instance was created

timeoutAt.description: Timestamp when the instance will automatically time out

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

401.description: Although the HTTP standard specifies "unauthorized", semantically this response means "unauthenticated". That is, the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

403.description: The client does not have access rights to the content; that is, it is unauthorized, so the server is refusing to give the requested resource. Unlike 401 Unauthorized, the client's identity is known to the server.

404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource. In the browser, this means the URL is not recognized. In an API, this can also mean that the endpoint is valid but the resource itself does not exist. Servers may also send this response instead of 403 Forbidden to hide the existence of a resource from an unauthorized client. This response code is probably the most well known due to its frequent occurrence on the web.

409.description: This response is sent when a request conflicts with the current state of the server.

429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time ("rate limiting")

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle.

post.summary: Create a new virtual desktop instance
post.description: Creates a new virtual desktop instance and returns its ID and stream URL

timeoutMs.description: Timeout in milliseconds for the desktop session

id.description: Unique identifier for the desktop instance

streamUrl.description: URL to stream the desktop via VNC

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

post.description: Stops a running desktop instance and cleans up resources

image.description: Base64 encoded image data (only returned for screenshot actions)

cursorPosition.description: Current cursor coordinates (only returned for get_cursor_position action)

post.summary: Perform an action on the desktop
post.description: Executes a computer action such as mouse clicks, keyboard input, or screenshots on the desktop

schema.description: Desktop instance ID to perform the action on

type.description: Perform a mouse action: click, press (down), or release (up). Defaults to a single left click at the current position.

x.description: X coordinate for the action (optional, uses current position if omitted)

y.description: Y coordinate for the action (optional, uses current position if omitted)

button.description: Mouse button to use (optional, defaults to 'left')

num_of_clicks.description: Number of clicks to perform (optional, defaults to 1, only applicable for 'click' type)

click_type.description: Type of mouse action (optional, defaults to 'click')

type.description: Scroll the mouse wheel in the specified direction
Move the mouse cursor to the specified coordinates
Drag the mouse from start to end coordinates

start.description: Starting coordinates for the drag operation

end.description: Ending coordinates for the drag operation

type.description: Type text at the current cursor position
Press, hold down, or release one or more keyboard keys. Defaults to a single press and release.

key_action_type.description: Type of key action (optional, defaults to 'press' which is a down and up action)

type.description: Wait for the specified number of milliseconds
Take a screenshot of the desktop
Get the current mouse cursor position

image.description: Base64 encoded image data (only returned for screenshot actions)

cursorPosition.description: Current cursor coordinates (only returned for get_cursor_position action)

post.summary: Execute a bash command on the desktop
post.description: Runs a bash command on the desktop and returns the command output

schema.description: Desktop instance ID to run the command on

status.description: Status of the bash command execution

output.description: Output from the bash command execution
